column3: Lunar Highland Pristine Rocks: Interelement Relationships

column4: Simonds, C. H., Warner, J. L.

column3: Chemical and Petrographic Study of Spinel Troctolite in 67435: Implications for the Origin of Mg-Rich Plutonic Rocks
column4: Ma, M. -S., Schmitt, R. A., Taylor, G. J., Warner, R. D., Keil, K.

column3: A summary of the petrology and geochemistry of pristine highlands rocks.
column5: Lunar and Planetary Science Conference Proceedings
column9: The petrology and geochemistry of pristine lunar highlands rock samples consisting of ferroan anorthosites, norites, troctolites, spinel troctolites/dunite/lherzolite, and KREEP, are described. In addition, petrographic and chemical evidence is presented which shows that low-siderophile rocks are the result of endogenous igneous activity and not impact melt differentiation. For example, these rocks contain Fe-metal as a late-crystallizing phase, and have W/La ratios higher than polymict breccias.
